SEARCH
Package io.github.ulalax.zmq

Class MultipartMessage

java.lang.Object
io.github.ulalax.zmq.MultipartMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<byte[]>
public final class MultipartMessage extends Object implements Iterable<byte[]>
Helper for multipart messages.

Multipart messages allow you to send multiple frames as a single atomic message. All frames are delivered together or not at all.

Sending example:


 MultipartMessage msg = new MultipartMessage();
 msg.addString("frame1");
 msg.addString("frame2");
 msg.send(socket);

Receiving example:


 MultipartMessage msg = MultipartMessage.recv(socket);
 for (byte[] frame : msg) {
     // process frame
 }
See Also:

    • recv

      public static MultipartMessage recv(Socket socket)
      Receives all frames from a socket (blocking).

      This method receives a complete multipart message with blocking semantics. It will block until the first frame is available, then continues receiving all remaining frames to maintain atomicity.

      Note: This is a convenience method that delegates to Socket.recvMultipart(). For non-blocking behavior, use socket.recvMultipart() directly and check the result.

      Error Recovery: If an error occurs while receiving subsequent frames, a ZmqException will be thrown with detailed context including the number of frames successfully received. The partial message is discarded to prevent processing incomplete data. Critical: The socket's internal state may be corrupted after such an error and the socket should be closed and recreated for reliable operation.

      Parameters:
      socket - The socket to receive from
      Returns:
      The complete multipart message
      Throws:
      ZmqException - if receive fails, with detailed context about which frame failed if the error occurred during subsequent frame reception
